summary: The Space Infrastructure Act (H.R. 1154) directs the Secretary of Homeland Security to designate space systems, services, and technology as a critical infrastructure sector. The Secretary must issue guidance on defining the sector's scope (including satellites, launch infrastructure, and IT), designating a Sector-Specific Agency, and identifying relevant advisory committees. A report to Congress on the guidance implementation is also required. Conforming amendments to the Homeland Security Act of 2002 are included. The Act aims to protect and secure vital space-based assets.
